Review.Titre: major ongoing issues with virtual phone number.
Review.Contenu: I was looking to set up a virtual phone number in Germany, and Tollfreeforwarding.com website stated that it could set up international phone numbers in 60 Seconds. That sounded promising, so I created an account, provided my credit card details and then..... a message stating that I needed to wait for something. The website gave me a phone number to call, if I didn't want to wait. So I called the support number, but ended up waiting indefinitely on hold... nearly two hours and still nothing, only an annoying voice that repeatedly promises that international calls can be set up immediately. Its very disappointing.. UPDATE: I've managed to get through to the call centre, only for the call to suspiciously drop out. During another call, my call was transferred to someone else who didn't know who I was or why I had been transferred. I've since been in contact with the team leader, but now I'm told it can take between 5 to 10 business days for the phone number to be connected. They are trying to expedite it following a complaint I made, however its in the hands of a third party telco provider in Germany. Hopefully TollFreeForwarding can liaise with the German telco to set up this number soon, I really need it for a job application in Germany. I wish they had been more transparent about the processing times for German numbers... then I would have applied for this number much earlier but I relied on their representation that this would only take a few minutes.Update: After a few days, the service was finally set up however IT DIDN'T WORK when I tested it-- when I tried calling the virtual phone number the target phone did not ring. I have reached out to tech support team.Update 2: Tech support team says they fixed it, however the service is still not working properly. Although the target phone now rings and I can answer the call, there is a high latency, which makes it impossible to communicate natural... call participants inevitably end up talking over each other. I have asked for service cancellation and a full refund because I can't use this product at all.

Since writing the review below, I have been contacted by the company and they are trying to  rectify the problem. I give them credit for their quick response to the review and to their efforts in resolving the situation  now and at the time the problem was first reported. Time is likely going to be a factor in resolving the problem in its entirety but the interim solutions that have been suggested by the company seem to be working. I am still a believer! So, two stars to begin with, four stars now and hopefully five stars in time. Too many wrong numbers. Suggest to me that the toll free numbers are handed out too soon before the last user finished with them. We experienced several calls asking for the same service - i.e. the service provided by an earlier user of the toll free number that we were provided. After contacting the company, they did try to correct it and they offered a small discount for the inconvenience. It was of no consolation as the wrong numbers continued. Eventually we had to limit the area from which the calls were emanating. This significantly reduced the number of wrong calls. I suggest that if you are considering this service, you do not update your documentation or publications with the new toll free number until you are satisfied you have received a number that has been properly vetted. We didn't; it was a costly lesson.
